arm_group.description: Participants receive standard WIC breastfeeding support but do not have contact with a breastfeeding peer counselor
Participants will receive four scheduled phone calls from a peer counselor. Two prenatal calls and 2 postpartum.
Participants will receive eight scheduled phone contacts from a peer counselor. Two are prenatal and 6 are postpartum.

brief_summary.textblock:
The U.S. Surgeon General has recommended that peer counseling to support breastfeeding
      become a core service of the Supplemental Nutrition Program for Women, Infants and Children
      (WIC).  As of 2008, 50 percent of WIC clients received services from local WIC agencies that
      offered peer counseling.  Little is known as to the effectiveness of these peer counseling
      programs.  Randomized controlled trials of peer counseling interventions among low-income
      women in the U.S. showed increases in breastfeeding initiation and duration, but it is
      doubtful that the level of support provided could be scaled up to service WIC clients
      nationally.   The investigators tested whether a telephone peer counseling program among WIC
      participants could increase breastfeeding initiation, duration and exclusivity.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Effect of Varied Intensities of Breastfeeding Peer Support on Duration of Breastfeeding Among Oregon WIC Participants

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Pregnant Oregon WIC participants in Jackson, Washington and Hood River counties or
             Umatilla Morrow Head Start.

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  WIC participant outside of the 4 study agencies.

clinical_study.official_title: The Effect of Varied Intensities of Breastfeeding Peer Support on Duration of Breastfeeding Among Oregon WIC Participants

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

collaborator.agency: U.S. Department of Agriculture, Food and Nutrition Service

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Single Group Assignment, Primary Purpose: Prevention
